p: An estimated 0.8 billion people and 50 trillion USD are exposed to a significant (1 in 100 year) river flood event (Scussolini et al., 2016). Given the diversity of hydroclimatological conditions across scales, adopting a national (or regional) allowance for the realization of future climate may fail to address the true emergent risk locally. Hence, critical to avoiding maladaptation is developing tools capable of identifying specific vulnerabilities under uncertain and often data‐poor conditions.
